tweets.text:
For the last couple of weeks petrol / diesel has been pouring into the Yare up stream of Marston Marshes @EnvAgencyAnglia.
-
I thought the floods might have carried it away for good but sadly something is still leaking badly into this local ecosystem. @NorfolkWT @EnvAgency https://t.co/3LrJ4tu0QH

When you couldn't think the @EnvAgency record on pollution investigation and enforcement couldn't get worse, hold on ... It's going to get worse. So, carry on polluting - there's little chance of being called out, let alone fined or prosecuted. https://t.co/JvlSGUDFQT

@mtaylor_lab Diesel still pouring out today along the Yare - evident for miles by sight and smell - that‚Äôs 7-10 days now.. what is it doing to our Norfolk Hawker, water vole etc? . As the river drops it coats the vegetation... https://t.co/QXRb4kacs9
@EnvAgencyAnglia Hi, is there any update on this oil pollution incident please?

tweets.text:
Do you know what to do in the event of a flood? Check out this infographic from the @EnvAgency  and why not sign up for flood warnings in your local area too! It's free!

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/hKs3r0VerP

@clivetrue @CliveJFox @EelGroup @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EU_ENV @EU_MARE @CITES @severnrivers while additional measures are also taken to overcome barriers and restore habitats. Restocking is a quick fit - hoping that the final solution will eventually come through.

Following heavy rainfall yesterday and overnight, we have operated the Foss Barrier to help protect properties in York. In this video, our asset performance advisor Mark Fuller explains how it works #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/mMPzvj913L

@EnvAgency Sally Gallagher MBE, Deborah Campbell BEM, Tom Fowler BEM, @ChrisPedlar1 Chris Pedlar BEM, @ForestryComm Anna Brown MBE. @ForestryEngland Mark Warn BEM.  Your hard work and contribution to,public life is hugely appreciated.

tweets.text:
Last week, after high tides #TeamEA dug out the tidal outfall at Hest Bank #Lancaster 

Our teams work 24/7, 365 days of the year not only to #ReduceFloodRisk but on any environmental incident. 

Report environmental incidents to us on 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/FLGacivhnH

tweets.text:
Our officers are attending an incident involving oil on the #RiverYare at Colney in #Norwich. 
A boom is in place to contain the pollutant and dog walkers are advised to avoid letting their pets enter the water. 
Officers will be back on site tomorrow for further investigations. https://t.co/Vc9tjbRwxR

tweets.text:
#Rickerby Flood Risk Management Scheme has reached completion

The scheme comprises 440m of new flood defence walls, 100m of raised flood embankment along with a new road alignment with improved hedges and tree planting for nature

#ReducingFloodRisk

Photo credit - @DrDWT https://t.co/Rt5OH3nmjj

Congratulations to colleagues in @DefraGovUK group recognised in #NewYearsHonours.  Marc Casale OBE, Gemma Harper OBE @Queen_of_Marine, Mark Sautereau OBE, Declan Kavanagh MBE. @APHAgovuk Lynne Bradley OBE, Samira Ahmed BEM, Colin Weaver BEM.

@TonyJuniper @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @ForestryEngland @DefraGovUK Yet we still see @ForestryComm restocking conifers on deep peat & planting new trees on peatlands with up to 50cm of peat. This really has to stop with immediate effect as a new year‚Äôs resolution & not hide behind tree planting & carbon targets as greenwash.

Flood warnings issued for Oxford
https://t.co/UP8idmtAif https://t.co/ebkn91hVSh
@EdenSwimmer @NECumbria @EnvAgency Well worth reading this as part of your continuing salmonid education. I'm sure it will further strengthen your connection with the river. https://t.co/R3lSij0IPh

@kernowbeaver @EmmaHowardBoyd @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @williamworsley @ForestryEngland @COP26 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK Or the flood management budget would be more appropriate @EnvAgency  PLUS give all unofficial wild beavers permission to stay. Then we can make progress to make room for rivers @TonyJuniper @DefraGovUK

@EmmaHowardBoyd @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @williamworsley @ForestryEngland @COP26 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK OK. Will you start to deploy a TINY amount of your budget into beaver restoration? That would look like ramping up action to tackle all the things you mention.
